title: MOVLHPS — Move Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values Low to High

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`MOVLHPS xmm1, xmm2`
`VMOVLHPS xmm1, xmm2, xmm3`
`VMOVLHPS xmm1, xmm2, xmm3`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: This instruction cannot be used for memory to register moves.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Moves two packed single-precision floating-point values from the low quadword of the second XMM argument (second operand) to the high quadword of the first XMM register (first argument). The low quadword of the destination operand is left unchanged. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are unmodified.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Moves two packed single-precision floating-point values from the low quadword of the third XMM argument (third operand) to the high quadword of the destination (first operand). Copies the low quadword from the second XMM argument (second operand) to the low quadword of the destination (first operand). Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: If VMOVLHPS is encoded with VEX.L or EVEX.L’L= 1, an attempt to execute the instruction encoded with VEX.L or EVEX.L’L= 1 will cause an #UD exception.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
